page.title: 04CHANGES IN THE CAMELS AREA
page.content: The greatest change that has taken place in our area during the past 40 years is the amount of traffic. The A303 used to be quiet enough for children to walk along, there were a few cars and some horses and carts. Now it is almost impossible to cross the road particularly during the summer months. There are now more people in the area than 40 years ago with a sudden surge in building in the last 12 years. Since people can travel easily now, they no longer need so many local shops. There are now only small general stores, and the butchers, ironmongers, saddlers and blacksmith have closed down. Prices in the shops have risen tremendously but then so have wages. Bus services have been cut in the past 15 years.
